channel.title: SoundRelief
channel.copyright: © 2010 American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology
channel.itunes:subtitle: SoundRelief, the official podcast of the American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology
channel.itunes:author: The American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology - ACAAI
channel.itunes:summary: Welcome to SoundRelief, the official consumer podcast of the American College of Allergy, Asthma and Immunology—featuring simple-to-follow tips, strategies and action plans to reduce the impact of allergies and asthma on your daily life. Featuring allergists--doctors who specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of allergic and immunologic diseases--each audio podcast will explore different topics related to allergy and asthma concerns.
channel.description: Welcome to SoundRelief, the official consumer podcast of the American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology–featuring simple-to-follow tips, strategies and action plans to reduce the impact of allergies and asthma on your daily life. Featuring allergists–doctors who specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of allergic and immunologic diseases–each two-minute audio podcast will explore different topics related to allergy and asthma concerns, including Surviving Spring allergies, Summer travel, Fall asthma triggers, Holiday food allergies and more!

itunes:owner.itunes:name: The American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology

item.title: Surviving Spring Allergies
item.itunes:author: The American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology - ACAAI
item.itunes:subtitle: Tips for surviving spring allergies both indoors and out.
item.itunes:summary: Did you know that allergy and asthma sufferers who see an Allergist are nearly three times more likely to say their treatment is more effective than taking Over The Counter medications? In this podcast, Allergist Richard Gower, MD, offers a number of practical tips and techniques for reducing the seasonal effects of spring allergies both when indoors and outside. He also discusses the effectiveness of immunotherapy, known as allergy shots, to accustom your body to tolerate the allergen, rather than react to it through sneezing, sniffling or coughing. Listen to this allergy podcast and find relief today!

item.title: Holiday Food Allergies
item.itunes:author: AllergyAndAsthmaRelief.org
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Richard Gower offers information on how to prevent food allergies from ruining the fun this holiday season.
